content: Is it intentional that Batteries.lean doesn't import all files in Batteries/?
Now I see that you do it differently than Mathlib.
Yury G. Kudryashov has marked this topic as resolved.

Yury G. Kudryashov said:

Now I see that you do it differently than Mathlib.

Can you elaborate a bit? I'm curious to the different solution but could not see it as the history of the file is lost due to renaming (Github mistakenly see it as renamed from Â Std/Classes/BEq.lean).
Instead of 1 top-level file including everything like Mathlib does, they have per-folder files.
In that case, some imports in Batteries.lean are duplicated with the corresponding per-folder files for now.
I see that I created a file in Batteries/Data/List and CI suggested that I add it to Batteries/Data/List.lean, not to Batteries.lean.
So in the long run, the imports in Batteries.lean would be only those per-folder files?

I don't know. I just see that CI makes sure that everything is imported, so there is nothing that needs to be fixed immediately. Since I'm not a Batteries maintainer, I decided not to spend more time on studying something I don't need to know.

Yury G. Kudryashov said:

I see that I created a file in Batteries/Data/List and CI suggested that I add it to Batteries/Data/List.lean, not to Batteries.lean.

Then it seems CI ensures the new import paradigm on new files, and leaves existing duplicated imports to chore PRs.
